summary: The Agriculture and National Security Act aims to bolster the connection between the Department of Agriculture (USDA) and national security agencies. Key provisions include establishing an Assistant Secretary of Agriculture for National Security, whose duties encompass advising the Secretary, acting as a liaison with national security entities, coordinating national security activities within the USDA, and identifying vulnerabilities in food and agriculture. The bill also enhances interagency coordination and mandates biennial reports to Congress and the National Security Council, assessing national security gaps and proposing solutions.
